qas.question: What is used to haul passengers cars?
How is electricity being generated for electric locomotives?
What entity provides distribution lines, switches and transformers?
Which railways haul passengers and freight in the same cars?
What is typically generated in small generating stations?
All electric railways have their own dedicated what?
Very few purchase power from whom?
What is generated in relatively inefficient stations?

context: <b3_0>Electric<b3_0/> railways use <a0_0>electric locomotives<a0_0/> to haul passengers or freight in separate cars or electric multiple units, passenger cars with their own motors. <b4_0><b7_0>Electricity<b7_0/><b4_0/> is typically generated in large and relatively efficient <a1_0>generating stations<a1_0/>, transmitted to the railway network and distributed to the trains. Some electric railways have their own dedicated <b5_0>generating stations and transmission lines<b5_0/> but most purchase power from <b6_0>an electric utility<b6_0/>. The <a2_0>railway<a2_0/> usually provides its own distribution lines, switches and transformers.
